conclusion: Both objects start from the same location and move in the same direction.
The graph shows the velocity of each object over time.
Focus on key times \( t_1, t_2, t_3, \) and \( t_4 \).
The areas under the curves for objects A and B need to be equal for the two objects to meet.
At \( t_2 \), both objects have the same velocity \( v_0 \).
The area under the curve for object A up to \( t_3 \) is larger than for object B because A had a higher velocity for a longer duration.
By \( t_4 \), the area under the curve for object B equals the area under the curve for object A.
Both objects meet when the areas under their respective velocity-time graphs are equal.
The two objects meet at time \( t_4 \).
